stone.io

Class InputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • stone.io.AbstractInputStream
        • stone.io.InputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class InputStream
extends AbstractInputStream
    A class for a BufferedInputStream reading from a file
    Author:
    Nelphindal

      • getMarkedLoc

        public final int getMarkedLoc()
                       throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Returns relative offset from current position in this stream to a previously marked location.
        Returns:
        relative offset from current position in this stream to marked location, -1 if there is no more mark
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more marked position is available

        Returns:
        byte array holding bytes read
        Throws:

      • readLine

        public final java.lang.String readLine()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes until next byte indicating new line (i.e. 0x0a) is reached. The byte 0x0a is removed as well as Windows line (0x0d 0x0a)
        Returns:
        bytes between current position and a 0x0a byte
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file

      • readTo

        public final byte[] readTo(byte terminal)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes until next byte matching given terminal is reached.
        Parameters:
        terminal - byte to stop reading at
        Returns:
        bytes between current position and given terminal byte
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file

      • readTo

        public final byte[] readTo(byte terminal,
                           byte mark)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes until next byte matching given terminal is reached. All positions of bytes matching given byte mark are marked
        Parameters:
        terminal - byte to stop reading at
        mark - byte to mark the position
        Returns:
        bytes between current position and given terminal byte
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the file
        See Also:
        getMarkedLoc()
